Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with green leaves to show it is getting enough water and light.
The student can draw a plant with wilted leaves to show it is not getting enough water.
The student can draw a plant that is pale or dying to show it is not getting enough light.
The student can draw a scene of plants outside under the sunlight to show plants need light to grow.
The student can draw raindrops or a watering can with a plant to show that plants need water to grow.
